actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to waive the 24-month waiting period for disabled individuals to qualify for medicare benefits in the case of individuals suffering from terminal illness with not more than 2 years to live.
short_title: Medicare for Individuals With Terminal Illnesses Act of 1999

summary.text: Medicare for Individuals with Terminal Illnesses Act of 1999 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to entitle to hospital insurance benefits under part A (Hospital Insurance) of SSA title XVIII (Medicare) each individual with a medically determinable physical impairment expected to result in the individual's death within the next 24 months who would otherwise be entitled to such Medicare hospital benefits but for the requirement that the individual be entitled to disability insurance benefits or other specified benefits by reason of such disability.

titles.title: Medicare for Individuals With Terminal Illnesses Act of 1999
A bill to waive the 24-month waiting period for disabled individuals to qualify for medicare benefits in the case of individuals suffering from terminal illness with not more than 2 years to live.
